subject: Testing Tomcat Servlets with Cactus
msgSnippet: Hi guys, I am trying to test a Tomcat site with Cactus. I haven t written a special Servlet to test, I just want to send the user name and password to the
messageBody:
Hi guys,

I am trying to test a Tomcat site with Cactus. I haven't written a
special Servlet to test, I just want to send the user name and
password to the login servlet and then verify the returned URL. The
problem is that if I open the pages with a browser it works - the
browser is redirected to the corect page, but if I try with cactus, it
always receives the same URL from Tomcat.

Here are two test samples:

public void beginLoginSPViaIDP(WebRequest theRequest) {
theRequest.setURL(
"localhost:8080",
"/sso-sample-sp/idp-logon",
null,
null,
null);
theRequest.addParameter("logon-providerID", "SourceID-Sample-IDP");
if (TestLogServlet.cookie != null) {
TestLogServlet.cookie = null;
}
}

public void testLoginSPViaIDP() {
}

public void endLoginSPViaIDP(WebResponse theResponse) {
sLogger.info(theResponse.getConnection().getURL());
Cookie[] aCookie = theResponse.getCookies();
for (int i = 0; i < aCookie.length; i++) {
if (aCookie[i].getPath().equals("/sso-sample-sp")) {
TestLogServlet.cookie = aCookie[i];
}
}
}



public void beginLoginSP1(WebRequest theRequest) {
theRequest.setURL(
"localhost:8080",
"/sso-sample-sp/sp-logon",
null,
null,
null);
theRequest.addParameter("userID", "user1");
theRequest.addParameter("password", "test");
if (TestLogServlet.cookie1 != null) {
TestLogServlet.cookie1 = null;
}
}

public void testLoginSP1() {
}

public void endLoginSP1(WebResponse theResponse) {
sLogger.info(theResponse.getConnection().getURL());
Cookie[] aCookie = theResponse.getCookies();
for (int i = 0; i < aCookie.length; i++) {
if (aCookie[i].getPath().equals("/sso-sample-sp")) {
TestLogServlet.cookie1 = aCookie[i];
}
}
}

I both tests I receive an URL with /sso-sample-sp in it while in the
first test the returned URL should be with /sso-sample-idp. At least
thats what I receive when I try it with my browser. Any suggestions...

Thanks.
Cheers
